p: Two leaf essential oil samples (S1 and S2) from I. dewevrei growing wild in Côte d’Ivoire were obtained by hydrodistillation of fresh leaves and the yields calculated on a weight basis ( w/ w) were 0.105 and 0.121%, respectively. The oil samples were first analyzed by a combination of GC(RI), GC-MS and 13C-NMR, following a computerized method developed at the University of Corsica. This method allowed identification of components present at a content as low as 0.4–0.5% and compiled in our laboratory-made 13C-NMR spectral data library [ 15, 16].
